description_txt: stated on March 26, 2013 in arguments before the U.S. Supreme Court:
quote_txt: "Very few men outlive their own fertility."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2013 in a congressional hearing:
quote_txt: The national debt is "larger than our entire annual economy."

description_txt: stated on March 19, 2013 in a response to the release of employment data by the state Labor Department:
quote_txt: "While the United States has seen its unemployment rate steadily decline, New Jersey's remains nearly two percent higher than the national average and more than a point higher than Connecticut and New York."

description_txt: stated on March 16, 2013 in a speech at the Conservative Political Action Conference:

description_txt: stated on February 25, 2013 in an interview.:

description_txt: stated on March 21, 2013 in a speech on the Senate floor:

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2013 in a joint mayoral candidates' appearance on MSNBC:

description_txt: stated on March 14, 2013 in a letter:

description_txt: stated on February 27, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "Even Roger Williams National Memorial in my home state of Rhode Island attracted nearly 51,000 visitors in 2011, with non local visitors adding more than $3.2 million to the local economy."

description_txt: stated on March 17, 2013 in an interview on “Fox News Sunday”:

description_txt: stated on January 22, 2013 in a letter to Portlanders:

description_txt: stated on March 24, 2013 in an appearance on 'Meet the Press':

quote_txt: "Do you know that, statistically, when you take the SAT a second time, one third of the people that take the SAT, even if they've been studying, will get a lower score than they did the first time around?"

description_txt: stated on March 6, 2013 in a floor speech:
